metadata.title: CVE-2022-3594 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function intr_callbackof the file drivers/net/usb/r8152.c of the component BPF. The manipulationleads to logging of excessive data. The attack can be launched remotely. Itis recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The associatedidentifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211363.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-lowlatency - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-azure - 4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.120').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2').
